member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.ButtonRoundedCorners.RenderingType
member.summary: Type of rendering logic that is used to create rounded corners around button.

remarks.p:
Warnings:
If FileImages is used (which is automatically enabled with all defaults), when Internet Explorer 6 may fail to load, background images and buttons becomes transparent. That problem can not be fixed by WebImageButton.
If BordersByTableCells is used and a particular browser fails to create a TD-html-element with the size of 1x1 pixels, then borders of button can be distorted and have increased width.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.ButtonRoundedCorners.MaxWidth
member.summary: Maximum allowed width of the control.
member.remarks: That property has effect only if ImageFiles is used and the Width of control in set in %. It prevents breaking background image on separate parts when width of control becomes too large.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.ButtonRoundedCorners.MaxHeight
member.summary: Maximum allowed height of the control.
member.remarks: That property has effect only if ImageFiles is used and Height of control in set in %. It prevents breaking background image on separate parts when height of control becomes too large.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.ButtonRoundedCorners.WidthOfRightEdge
member.summary: Width of the rectangle on the right side of a control that is used to render the right edge of a background image.
member.remarks:
The larger the radius of the edges of a background image, the larger the value of that property should be.
That area can not contain text or image, so it is similar to the right-padding.
If this property is set to 0, then the width of control is defined by the value of the MaxWidth property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.ButtonRoundedCorners.HeightOfBottomEdge
member.summary: Height of a rectangle on the bottom side of a control that is used to render the bottom edge of a background image.
member.remarks:
The larger the radius of the edges of a background image, the larger the value of this property should be.
That area can not contain text or an image, so, it is similar to the bottom-padding.
If this property is set to 0, then the height of the control is defined by the value of the MaxHeight property.

member.name: T:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.ClientSideEvents
member.summary: Object that keeps the list of names for event function handlers used by JavaScript on client side.
member.remarks:
Because of the stateless nature of web connections, and the typical delays involved in returning information from the server, WebMenu implements both client-side events and server-side events. You can choose whether you would like to respond to client-side events, which must be implemented through JavaScript. The ClientSideEvents object maintains a list of event handlers that are implemented on the client and called in response to events as they occur in the browser. Each event is a string that represents JavaScript function name. The named function must be implemented by the developer in JavaScript code.
Every event function handler should have 3 parameters (the InitializeCalendar has only 1 parameter). The first parameter contains reference to the JavaScript object that represents UltraWebTab.
The second parameter contains reference to the JavaScript object that represents Tab.
The third parameter contains reference to the JavaScript object that represents Event.
Look at the events description for details.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.ClientSideEvents.Initialize
member.summary: Event fired after the control was initialized.

remarks.p:
It can be the name of implemented function or explicit javascript statement(s). If the name of function is used, then that event handler may contain 2 parameters.
1st parameter contains reference to the TextEdit object
2nd parameter contains instant text that appears in editor

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.ClientSideEvents.ValueChange
member.summary: Event fired when the control loses the input focus and the value was modified.

remarks.p:
It can be the name of an implemented function or explicit javascript statement(s). If the name of the function is used, then that event handler may contain 3 parameters.
1st parameter contains reference to the TextEdit object.
2nd parameter contains reference to the old value (value before the change).
3rd parameter contains reference to the ig_EventObject object.
This event can be canceled.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.ClientSideEvents.TextChanged
member.summary: Event fired when the text was modified by the user.

remarks.p:
It can be the name of an implemented function or explicit javascript statement(s). If the name of the function is used, then that event handler may contain 3 parameters.
1st parameter contains reference to the TextEdit object.
2nd parameter contains new text in editor.
3rd parameter contains reference to the ig_EventObject object.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.ClientSideEvents.InvalidValue
member.summary: Event fired when the control loses the input focus and has an invalid value.

remarks.p:
It can be the name of implemented function or explicit javascript statement(s). If the name of function is used, then that event handler may contain 3 parameters.
1st parameter contains reference to the TextEdit object
2nd parameter contains object that is different for every particular editor. In case of WebDateTimeEditor it is the reference to the object that contains instant values of date fields, suggested date, and type of invalid event.
3rd parameter contains reference to the ig_EventObject object
If that event was canceled by the oEvent.cancel=true;, then the Server is not notified about invalid value.
In case of WebDateTime editor, if the value if the fields.date was modified, then that suggested value is used automatically.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.InvalidValueType.Invalid
member.summary:
Invalid string which could not be converted to a valid value.
In case of WebNumericEdit it is fired when the following strings were entered: ".", "-.", "-".
In the case of WebDateTimeEdit, the last good date value was used as the new value.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.InvalidValueType.MinMaxLimit
member.summary: Entered value was beyond minimum or maximum limits.

member.name: F:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.InvalidValueType.FieldValue
member.summary:
Wrong values of fields, missing field value, etc.
In the case of WebNumericEdit it is fired when the empty string was entered and a null value was not allowed. In the case of WebDateTimeEdit it is fired when some date fields had invalid values, but a new-suggested value was constructed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.SpinButtons.DefaultTriangleImages
member.summary: Size of default triangle images.

remarks.p: If ImageUrl property of a button is set or if ButtonsAppearance.ButtonStyle.ForeColor is not set, then default triangle images for that button are not displayed.
Color of triangle image for a particular state of button is defined by the ButtonsAppearance.ButtonXxxStyle.ForeColor properties.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.SpinButtons.Display
member.summary: Visibility and layout of spin buttons.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.SpinButtons.Delay
member.summary: Initial delay in milliseconds between increment/decrement spin events.

remarks.p: Default value is set to 200.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.SpinButtons.Delta
member.summary: Value that is used to increment/decrement the editing value on spin events.

remarks.p: That value is also used when increment/decrement happens on the up/down arrow keys.
In the case of zero, the value of 1 of the field where caret was is used.
Default value is set to 1. In the case of a date editor, it is 1 day and in case of a time editor it is 1 minute.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.SpinButtons.SpeedUpRate
member.summary: Ability to automatically increase/decrease the delay with spin events.

remarks.p:
This property allows to increase, decrease or keep permanent delay between spin events.
Positive values will gradually decrease delay (increase speed) until the value of the (Delay / 2 ^ value) is reached.
Negative values will increase delay (decrease speed) until the value of the (Delay * 2 ^ value) is reached.
Value of zero will keep permanent delay between spin events.
Range of values is -3..0..+6. The value of -3 will slow down initial delay in 8 times. The value of 6 will speed up initial delay in 64 times.
Default value is set to 3.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.SpinButtons.SpinOnArrowKeys
member.summary: Ability to increment/decrement a value on the Up/Down arrow keys.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.SpinButtons.SpinOnReadOnly
member.summary: Ability to increment/decrement a value when ReadOnly is true.

remarks.p: Default value is set to false.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.SpinButtons.SpinOnlyOneField
member.summary: Ability to increment/decrement the value of only one field.

remarks.p:
This property is applied only to date editor.
If value is true, then only one current field is incremented/decremented and all other fieds remain unchanged.
If value is false, then other date fields can be affected too.
Default value is set to false.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.SpinButtons.EnsureFocus
member.summary: Ability to ensure input focus with spin events.

remarks.p: If that property is false and a spin-button is pressed, then value is incremented/decremented, though, focus remains at the control which had input focus before a spin-button was pressed.
Default value is set to false.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.SpinButtons.Width
member.summary: Width of spin buttons excluding borders.

remarks.p: If button has image, then width can not be smaller than the width of image.
If value is not set, then 12 pixel is used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.WebTextEdit.EnableAppStyling
member.summary: Enables support on this WebDataInput editor control for the Application Styling Framework(tm).
member.value: True indicates Application Styling is enabled, False indicates Application Styling is disabled, and NotSet indicates support for Application Styling should default to page- or application-level settings.

remarks.p: Turn on support for Application Styling of WebDataInput when using the Application Styling Framework(tm) (ASF) by setting the EnableAppStyling property to True.

When EnableAppStyling has it's default value of NotSet, this control will defer the determination of whether to use Application Styling to settings you make at the page- or application-level. Place the WebPageStyler control on the same Web form as this control to configure ASF support for all controls on that Page. ASF support can also be turned on application-wide with the enableAppStyling attribute in your "web.config" file.
Turn off support for the ASF in WebDataInput (even though it may have been enabled at a higher level) by setting the EnableAppStyling property to False.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.WebTextEdit.StyleSetName
member.summary: Name of the Application Styling Framework(tm) style set defining the themed appearance for this control.

value.p: The name of the Application Styling Framework(tm) (ASF) style set which has been designed to give this control a consistent appearance with other controls in your application.
This property may return the empty string ("") to imply that the default style set (named "Default") should be used.

remarks.p: Web sites can configure a single, consistent, application-wide style set through the styleSetName attribute in their "web.config" file. Alternately, they can define the style set to apply Application Styling to all controls on a Page by placing a WebPageStyler control on that Page and setting it's StyleSetName property.
At the control level this property allows an application developer to customize the style set applied to a single instance of a control.

Normally, graphics designers will furnish you with a style set containing one or more style sheet files (one for each type of control) and image files. The name of the style set (with the exception of the "Default" style set) must appear in each Cascading Style Sheet (CSS) class name defined by this control's style sheet file. For example, two WebTree controls that each use a different style set, "Aqua" and "Onyx", would expect their CSS class names for the ASF Node role to be "igtr_AquaNode" and "igtr_OnyxNode", respectively. This allows the uniqueness of CSS class names necessary to distinguish multiple style sets for the same type of control, without there being any naming collisions.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.WebTextEdit.StyleSetPath
member.summary: Path containing the Application Styling Framework(tm) style set files for this type of control.

remarks.p: Web sites can configure the directory path containing their style set files application-wide by using the styleSetPath attribute of their "web.config" file. It is also possible to configure the style set path applicable to all controls on a Page that are subject to Application Styling by placing a WebPageStyler control on that Page and setting it's StyleSetPath property.
At the control level this property allows an application developer to customize the location of the style set being applied to a single instance of a control.

Be aware that customizing the style set path at the control level will not allow you to copy a style set's files to this new location, changing a few style property values in them, and then use it successfully with separate instances of the control referencing the original style set of the same name. This is because there would be naming collisions in the Cascading Style Sheet (CSS) class names, which will produce an undefined appearance. You must ensure the CSS class names defined by style sheets in the new style set path are unique from those CSS class names being used by other style sheets that may continue to be referenced. The recommended guidance in this scenario is to create a new style set having a new style set name, that contains your modifications.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.WebDateTimeEdit.EditModeFormat
member.summary: Format of date used for edit mode when control has input focus.

remarks.p: Default value is set to the "d". If string has length of 1 (single flag-character such as: d, f, g, s, etc.), then the System.Threading.Thread.CurrentThread.CurrentCulture is used to obtain date pattern. Otherwise, this property is treated as explicit date pattern.
Example of explicit pattern: "dd-MM-yyyy" To learn about format flags and patterns, see documentation for the System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo class.
Note The "z" and "g" characters and "%c" style in pattern are ignored. Possible day of the week field is ignored, and abbriviated month name is converted to digit.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.WebDateTimeEdit.DisplayModeFormat
member.summary: Format of date used for display mode when control has no input focus.

remarks.p: Default value is set to the empty string. If the string is empty, then the value of is used. If the string has a length of 1 (single flag-character such as: d, f, g, s, etc.), then the System.Threading.Thread.CurrentThread.CurrentCulture is used to obtain date pattern. Otherwise, this property is treated as explicit date pattern.
Example of an explicit pattern: "dd-MM-yyyy" To learn about format flags and patterns, see documentation for the System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo class.
Note The "z" and "g" characters and "%c" style in pattern are ignored.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.WebDateTimeEdit.MinimumNumberOfValidFields
member.summary: Minimum number of valid fields in the date string which must be present to consider the date valid.

remarks.p: Range of values: 0-7. If this property is set to 0, all fields are validated. Default value is 3.

Missing hour, minute, second, millisecond fields are replaced by 0, and missing year, month, day fields are replaced by the fields of the today date. Date fields are counted from the left to right as they appear in the pattern of date format.

When validating, the day-of-week and AM-PM fields are skipped and not included for the purposes of this property. For example, if the pattern of date format is "M-d-yy H:mm:ss" and the MinimumNumberOfValidFields is 4, the following then strings are validated as indicated:

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.WebDateTimeEdit.YearToFillCentury
member.summary: Value that is used to autofill year field to the 20th or 21st century if only 1 or 2 digits are entered.

remarks.p: Range of values: from -1 to 99.
If value is set to -1, then autofill is disabled.
If entered year is less or equal to the value of that property, then 2000 is added to the year field.
If entered year is larger than the value of that property and less than 100, then 1900 is added to the year field.
Default value is 29.

remarks.p:
The Culture property allows to customize all aspects of format that is applied to a DateTime object while converting it to string. Those format properties include field separators, date/time patterns, names of months, etc.
If value is not set, then the System.Threading.Thread.CurrentThread.CurrentCulture.DateTimeFormat object is used.
Abbriviated month names for short-date pattern are not supported and months are converted to digits.

member.summary: Collection of properties that are used to enable painting of rounded corners defined by background images.

remarks.p:
Warnings:
If FileImages is used (which is automatically enabled with all defaults), then the InternetExplorer6 may fail to load background images and then button becomes transparent. That problem can not be fixed by the WebImageButton.
If BordersByTableCells is used and a particular browser fails to create a TD-html-element with the size of 1x1 pixels, then borders of the button can be distorted and have increased width.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.WebImageButton.StylePreset
member.summary: Configure appearance related properties using predefined values.

remarks.p: Note: The value of this property is not written to the ViewState and, therefore, it is not persistant between sessions. However, that property modifies many other (appearance related) properties, which are persistant between sessions if the ViewState is enabled. It means that if this property is set at run time, then it will result in significant increase of the size of the hidden-view-state-field which is passed to the client.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.WebMaskEdit.InputMask
member.summary: Input mask used to filter keyboard entries.
member.remarks:
Default value is set to "CCCCCCCCCCCC".
The mask may contain literal characters and input-mask-flags such as
& - any keyboard character (entry is required)
L - letter (entry is required)
0, # - digit (entry is required)
A - letter or digit (entry is required)
C - any keyboard character (entry is optional)
? - letter (entry is optional)
9 - digit (entry is optional)
a - letter or digit (entry is optional)
> - all letters to the right are converted to the upper case
< - all letters to the right are converted to the lower case
For information on how to customize input masks, see the following topic section of the help: Developer's Guide > The Toolset > Controls and Components > WebMaskEdit.
Notes:
If in front of any flag-character appears the "\" (escape) character, then that character becomes the literal part of mask. For example, if mask is set to the "A\A\BB\\##\99" and control has no data, then text in edit mode will appear as "_A\BB\#_9_". Where the "_" are available positions for entry.
To cancel upper/lower case convertion which was set by the > or < flag, that flag should be used one more time. For example, if mask is set to the ">CC->CC->CC" and user entered the "XxXxXx", then resulting text should appear as "XX-Xx-XX".
While control has no input focus, the optional empty mask positions are not displayed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.WebMaskEdit.PadChar
member.summary: Character that is used to fill required empty mask positions in the display text while the control does not have focus.

remarks.p: Default value is set to the Space character.
While control has no input focus, the optional empty mask positions are not displayed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.WebMaskEdit.PromptChar
member.summary: Character that is used to fill empty mask positions in the display text while the control has focus.

remarks.p: Default value is set to the '_' (underscore) character.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.WebMaskEdit.EmptyPositionChar
member.summary: Character that is used to replace empty (not filled) positions in the while building string returned by the and properties.

remarks.p: Default value is set to the Space character.
This property is designed for situation when empty position characters expected by application (database) would be confusing if used as prompts. For example '?' or '0' characters.

member.name: P:Infragistics.WebUI.WebDataInput.WebMaskEdit.DataMode
member.summary: Specifies rules that are used to get/set the property.

remarks.p:
Those rules define various combinations of the following conditions:
Whether or not the literal characters (not editable part of mask) should be included.
Whether or not the required empty mask positions should be included.
Whether or not the optional empty mask positions should be included.
Default value is set to 'RawTextWithRequiredPrompts'. This property is designed to be used when this editor is embedded into grid or other control.

Note: When literal characters are included and the value is set, then characters in that new value which positions match with the positions of the literal characters in mask are ignored. Though, those "dummy" characters should be present in the value, otherwise, the "data" characters will be lost and may appear shifted to wrong positions.
